personalWebsite.title: Personal Website
personalWebsite.content:
**Building a Personal Website with React, TypeScript, and Modern Frontend Tools**

Creating a personal website is more than just putting together a few static pages—it’s about building a fast, scalable, and dynamic experience that reflects both technical skills and design sensibility. In this project, I built a personal site powered by **React** and **TypeScript**, using **Vite 6** for its remarkable build performance and developer experience. With **Tailwind CSS**, the design achieves a clean, responsive layout, complete with dark mode support for enhanced accessibility and visual comfort.

### Frontend Architecture and Design

The foundation of this website is built with **React** and **TypeScript**, ensuring strong type safety and modularity. Vite’s lightning-fast hot module replacement and optimized bundling workflow significantly improve iteration speed during development. Styling is handled by **Tailwind CSS**, which simplifies building a cohesive UI through utility-first classes, while **tailwind-merge** and **PostCSS** streamline class management and ensure design consistency across components.

### Routing and Internationalization

Navigation is handled by **React Router**, providing a seamless single-page application (SPA) experience. Recognizing the importance of accessibility and localization, the site implements **i18next** with **react-i18next**, allowing dynamic language switching between English and Chinese. Browser language detection is integrated to automatically serve content in the user’s preferred language, improving usability for a global audience.

### Content Rendering and Interactivity

Dynamic content areas use **react-markdown** to render Markdown-based content, supporting tables, lists, and other rich-text elements. This enables flexible content updates without modifying the core codebase. Additionally, custom **React Hooks** manage the state of interactive elements such as image carousels, delivering a smooth and engaging browsing experience. UI elements are further enhanced with **react-icons**, offering a consistent visual layer across the site.

### Deployment and Hosting

The final project is deployed on **Firebase Hosting**, providing fast global delivery, straightforward version management, and seamless CI/CD integration. This setup allows for rapid updates and ensures that new features and improvements reach users quickly.

### Key Technologies

- **React** + **TypeScript** for scalable and maintainable code architecture
- **Vite 6** for rapid development and optimized builds
- **Tailwind CSS** with dark mode support for responsive, modern design
- **React Router** for efficient front-end routing
- **i18next / react-i18next** for multilingual support and localization
- **react-markdown**, **react-icons**, **PostCSS**, and **tailwind-merge** for content and UI enhancements
- **Firebase Hosting** for reliable deployment and distribution

This project demonstrates how modern frontend tools can seamlessly integrate to deliver a performant, elegant, and globally accessible personal website—combining technical precision with thoughtful user experience.

theHopeConferenceApp.title: TheHope Conference APP
theHopeConferenceApp.content:
### TheHope Conference APP - Backend Development

In building **TheHope Conference APP**, our engineering team placed strong emphasis on scalability, performance, and maintainability. In the team, I mainly focus on the development and design of backend systems. The **Conference Portal API (conf-portal-api)** is the backbone of the system, designed as a modern RESTful service powered by **FastAPI** and **Python 3.13**. Leveraging an **asynchronous architecture**, it ensures high throughput and responsiveness—fundamental for a dynamic event platform serving global users.

---

## API Project Overview (conf-portal-api)

TheHope Conference Portal API is built to deliver a fast, reliable, and secure backend service. Below is a breakdown of its major components and technologies.

### Backend Framework & Runtime Environment

- **FastAPI** provides an asynchronous, high-performance web framework with automatic OpenAPI documentation generation, allowing both rapid development and clean API specification.
- **Gunicorn + Uvicorn** serve as our ASGI stack, enabling robust and scalable request processing.
- **Poetry** is used for dependency management, ensuring consistent environment reproducibility across development and deployment stages.

### Database & Caching

To support a stable and efficient data layer:
- **PostgreSQL** is our primary database, paired with **SQLAlchemy ORM** and **asyncpg** for asynchronous query execution.
- **Redis** operates as a caching layer and also provides rate limiting and token blacklist capabilities—improving both performance and security.
- **Alembic** manages database migrations, keeping schema evolution safe and version-controlled.

### Authentication & Authorization

Security remains central in handling user and admin interactions:
- **Firebase Admin SDK** manages authentication for regular users, enabling seamless integration with modern identity providers.
- **JWT (PyJWT)** handles administrator authentication and token lifecycle.
- **RBAC (Role-Based Access Control)** enforces granular access control through verbs, resources, permissions, and roles—ensuring consistent governance across services.

### Architecture & Observability

The system embraces modularity, testability, and observability:
- **Dependency Injection (dependency-injector)** structures our service composition with clean, scalable patterns.
- **Pydantic** validates and serializes data models, improving payload reliability and configuration management.
- **OpenTelemetry** combined with **Sentry** enables distributed tracing and performance monitoring, providing deep insights into service health and troubleshooting.

### Supporting Features

To complement the API’s core capabilities:
- **AWS S3 (boto3)** powers scalable file storage for conference assets.
- **SMTP (aiosmtplib)** facilitates asynchronous email sending with templating handled by **Jinja2**, ensuring professional and dynamic communication.
- **Redis-based Rate Limiting** prevents abuse and ensures fair usage.
- **CORS** configuration ensures safe cross-origin communication for web and mobile applications.

### Development Tools & Testing

Quality assurance and developer efficiency are achieved through robust tooling:
- **pytest**, **pytest-asyncio**, and **pytest-mock** support comprehensive and asynchronous test suites.
- **Click** provides a clean command-line interface for maintenance tasks and operational automation.

---

TheHope Conference Portal API exemplifies modern backend engineering with its asynchronous design, modular architecture, and cloud-native integrations. From authentication and observability to DevOps-friendly toolchains, every element aims to provide a reliable foundation for a seamless conference experience. This infrastructure not only supports present needs but also ensures scalability and adaptability for future growth of TheHope’s digital ecosystem.

theHopeConferenceAdminPortal.title: TheHope Conference Admin Portal
theHopeConferenceAdminPortal.content:
### TheHope Conference Admin Portal - Frontend Project Overview

TheHope Conference Admin Portal represents a modern and efficient frontend application designed to empower administrators in managing all aspects of the conference system. Built with **React 19** and **TypeScript 5.7**, this Single Page Application (SPA) adopts a cutting-edge frontend technology stack, offering both high maintainability and an exceptional development experience.

---

## Core Framework

At the foundation of the project lies **React 19.0.0**, embracing the latest functional component paradigm and Hooks API. With **TypeScript 5.7.2**, the portal ensures strong type safety and better developer tooling. **Vite 6.1.0** powers the build system and development server, delivering blazing-fast builds and hot module replacement.

---

## Routing and State Management

The portal leverages **React Router 7.1.5** for routing, supporting dynamic route generation and role-based access control. Global states such as authentication, menu configuration, theme, and sidebar visibility are managed using **React Context API**, through modular contexts like `AuthContext`, `MenuContext`, `ThemeContext`, and `SidebarContext`.

---

## UI and Styling

A modern admin panel demands both usability and aesthetics. TheHope Admin Portal utilizes **Tailwind CSS 4.0.0**, embracing utility-first atomic styling to achieve design consistency and flexibility. Iconography is handled through **React Icons**, with a preference for the Material Design (md) set. The team has also built a **custom UI component library**, promoting reusability and scalability across the system.

---

## Data and API Architecture

The project integrates **Axios 1.11.0** as the HTTP client, equipped with request and response interceptors for better error handling and token management. **Firebase** authentication is seamlessly integrated on the frontend, while the API service layer, organized under `api/services/`, isolates network logic from UI components. This structure enhances maintainability and supports clear separation of concerns.

---

## Functional Components

The portal’s functional depth is enriched through several specialized components and integrations:

- **React Dropzone** for file uploading
- **React Helmet Async** for managing page titles and meta tags
- **SimpleBar React** for custom scrollbar design
- **Moment.js + Moment Timezone** for precise time and timezone handling

---

## Developer Experience

From a developer’s perspective, the project is designed to be highly ergonomic. Features such as **strict TypeScript mode**, **path aliasing** (where `@` maps to the `src` directory), **SVG support** via `vite-plugin-svgr`, and multi-environment configuration (dev, staging, production) all contribute to efficient development workflows and consistent deployments.

---

## Architectural Highlights

TheHope Admin Portal’s architecture is centered on flexibility, scalability, and security:

- **Dynamic routing system** built on permission-based route generation
- **RBAC (Role-Based Access Control)** aligned with the backend's authorization system
- **Responsive design** optimized for multiple screen sizes
- **Theme switching** supporting both light and dark modes

---

## Integration and System Design

TheHope Conference solution follows a **frontend-backend separation** model. The frontend SPA interacts with backend services via **RESTful APIs** and integrates **Firebase authentication** alongside robust **RBAC permission management**. Together, they deliver a complete, secure, and modern conference management ecosystem that balances performance, usability, and scalability.

---

The TheHope Conference Admin Portal demonstrates a state-of-the-art frontend implementation that blends modern frameworks, developer efficiency, and enterprise-grade architecture. It stands as a powerful administrative interface tailored for high-performance event management.
